item.title: quotations
item.description: The Eden Express, Mark Vonnegut Among amateurs, most “touch-move” games are lost on stupid blunders. The game becomes pointless very early: neither player learns anything. I’m capable of playing a good game of touch-move, but I have a hard time enjoying it. I beat players I should lose to and lose to players I should beat. Either way, it leaves a bad taste in my mouth. Touch-move fans argue with equal fervor that being able to take moves back ruins the game.
